Redux"s store, holding all reducers specified by the combined reducer: "/redux/reducers/app.js" Copyright (c) 2015 ezHome - http://ezhome.com
Proprietary License

ReduxState.name: ReduxState
ReduxState.description:
Returns the web-applications initial state, used by Redux. Copyright (c) 2015 ezHome - http://ezhome.com
Proprietary License

MixinStateListener.name: MixinStateListener
MixinStateListener.description:
Mixin for react-Components, which will ensure that ste Component gets re-rendered whenever the Redux-store changes. Copyright (c) 2015 ezHome - http://ezhome.com
Proprietary License

ReduxValidate.name: ReduxValidate
ReduxValidate.description:
Validator for Redux-store objects. Will be used by Redux-reducers. Copyright (c) 2015 ezHome - http://ezhome.com
Proprietary License

ViewCareers.name: ViewCareers
ViewCareers.description:
Careers view react-component, which gets rendered after the router invokes "reply.reactview("careers");" Copyright (c) 2015 ezHome - http://ezhome.com
Proprietary License

ViewFAQ.name: ViewFAQ
ViewFAQ.description:
Faq view react-component, which gets rendered after the router invokes "reply.reactview("faq");" Copyright (c) 2015 ezHome - http://ezhome.com
Proprietary License

ViewHome.name: ViewHome
ViewHome.description:
Home view react-component, which gets rendered after the router invokes "reply.reactview("home");" Copyright (c) 2015 ezHome - http://ezhome.com
Proprietary License

MainApp.name: MainApp
MainApp.description:
Main App that always runs on the client. Is also responsible for clientside routing. Copyright (c) 2015 ezHome - http://ezhome.com
Proprietary License

ServerConfig.name: ServerConfig
ServerConfig.description:
Server configuration as set by reactserver.config.json Copyright (c) 2015 ezHome - http://ezhome.com
Proprietary License

Routes.name: Routes
Routes.description:
Routes for the Hapi-server Copyright (c) 2015 ezHome - http://ezhome.com
Proprietary License

classitems.description:
When fulfilled, the promise returns an object with city-customers,
where every key is the city-location.

classitems.description: Holds the ezhome links to facebook, twitter etc.

When fulfilled, the promise returns an array with faq categories,
which are objects, holding the category"s questions and answers.

classitems.description: Retrieves the workable data through a http-request.
classitems.name: getWorkableData

return.description: when fulfilled, the response-value is an array with the data

classitems.description:
Retrieves the workable-data in the correct form that can be processed by the `careers`-view (page).
Will use a cached-value when present. The cached value is updated every `REFRESH_INTERVAL` minutes.
classitems.name: getData

return.description: when fulfilled, the response-value is an array with the data

classitems.description: When fulfilled, the promise returns an array with zipcodes (Strings).

cached every 30 minutes.

classitems.description:

classitems.description:
Will reset the pageview either the landing-page, or the detail-page-alternative,
depending on the hash in the browser-url. This way the ser will see the right page
whever there is a full pageload.

Do not use this method directly, to prevent running into situations where the page has gone while the app is
yet present. Use "NavigatePage" instead.
classitems.name: _NavigatePage

classitems.description:
Sets the focus to the first `AvailabilityNode` with a delay os 500ms
This delay is needed to prevent Google-Places from set its dropdownlist
at the wrong x-position
classitems.name: _focusAvailabilityNode

classitems.description:
Sets up all events. None of the "instance"-events need to be detached,
this happens full automaticly.
classitems.name: setupEvents

classitems.description:
Will switch the view into "detail-page-alternative".
By emitting a "saveHistoryHash"-event.

This event gets handled by the main-App, which ensures the navigation and url location-update take places.
classitems.name: showDetailPageAlternative

classitems.description: Event to trigger the view to go to a new hash. Gets handled by the MainApp.
classitems.name: view:saveHistoryHash

params.name: e.hash
params.description: the hash where the view should go into

classitems.description:
Will switch the view into "landingpage-alternative".
By emitting a "saveHistoryHash"-event.

This event gets handled by the main-App, which ensures the navigation and url location-update take places.
classitems.name: showLandingPage

classitems.description:
Will reset the pageview either the landing-page, or the detail-page-alternative,
depending on the hash in the browser-url. This way the ser will see the right page
whever there is a full pageload.
classitems.name: tryNavigatePage

params.name: e
params.description: eventobject when called by the "router:navigate" event

classitems.description:
Returns the current state of the web-application as an immutable object.
(just a plain object, but without any shared references)
classitems.name: getState

return.description: the current state of the web-application

classitems.description:
Sets a new state, specified by the "action", which should be a Redux-action
Valid Redux-actions are within the folder: "/redux/actions".
classitems.name: dispatch

classitems.description:
Subscribes a callback function to whenever Redux changes its state.
Typically, this should be set within the "componentDidMount"-method of a React-Component.

The return-value is a function that should be used to detach the subscriber.
Typically, detaching should be set within the "componentWillUnmount"-method of a React-Component.
classitems.name: subscribe

params.name: callback
params.description: the function to be invoked when the Redux-state changes

return.description: a handler to detach the subscription

classitems.description: Replaces the reducer that the store AppStore.
classitems.name: replaceReducer

params.name: newReducer
params.description: the new Reducer to be used by the store.

The String where the assets of this specific version are.
Typically like: `/assets/0.0.1/`
Use this if you want the url to the assets with a dynamically version-number
that matches the production-version
classitems.name: __assetsdir

classitems.description: meta char-set
classitems.name: __charset

classitems.description: meta description
classitems.name: __description

classitems.description: The device that the visitor is using: "desktop", "tablet" or "mobile"
classitems.name: __device

classitems.description: Google-analytics api-key
classitems.name: __ga

classitems.description:
Url for the shared script-file. This files is generated by webpack as common-script,
and also holds all webpack-functionality which runs on the client.
classitems.name: __itsacommonscript

classitems.description: The bundled inline css content: bundled for this specific pageview only
classitems.name: __itsapageinlinecss

classitems.description: Url for the bundled css: bundled for this specific pageview only
classitems.name: __itsapagelinkcss

classitems.description: Url for the page(view)-specific script-file. This files is generated by webpack as a chunck-file.
classitems.name: __itsapagescript

classitems.description:
The language to be used for this page. Is being controlled by the visitor,
either by its lang-preferences, or whenever the visitor changes to another
language through the web-application (f.e. "en").
classitems.name: __lang

classitems.description:
The language-prefix that currently is in the url, whenever u user
manually switched to another language (f.e. "/fr").
classitems.name: __langprefix

classitems.description:
An hash with all available languages for this web-application.
F.e. {"en": "default, "fr": true, "nl": true}
classitems.name: __languages

classitems.description: The locales on the client
classitems.name: __locales

classitems.description: The active url-pathname
classitems.name: __path

classitems.description: Active routes (from /routes.js) that can be used for client-side rendering
classitems.name: __routes

classitems.description: The time that sessions may be kept in localstorage
classitems.name: __sessiontime

classitems.description: The title for the page
classitems.name: __title

classitems.description: The active uri
classitems.name: __uri

classitems.description: Full useragent-information
classitems.name: __useragent

classitems.description: The version of the web-application
classitems.name: __version

classitems.description: The name of the page"s view
classitems.name: __view

classitems.description: meta viewport
classitems.name: __viewport

classitems.description: The Component its children, which basicly consist of one react-component: the view.
classitems.name: children

classitems.description: The city-customers info where ezhome is currently active
classitems.name: cityCustomers

classitems.description: Whether to landingpage should be set on "city-landing" or "video"
classitems.name: cityLanding

classitems.description: ezhome's urls's to facebook, twitter etc.
classitems.name: {String} ezhomeURLs.pinterest link to ezhome's pinterest-page

classitems.description: An hash with all messages in the current language.
classitems.name: messages

classitems.description: ezhome's service-rates for weekly and two-weekly services.
classitems.name: {Number} serviceRates.startPriceWeeklyService rate for weekly service (in $)

classitems.description: The zipcodes where ezhome is currently active
classitems.name: zipCodes

classitems.description: componentDidMount will initiate the Home"s subApp.
classitems.name: componentDidMount

classitems.description: componentWillUnmount will destroy the Home"s subApp.
classitems.name: componentWillUnmount

classitems.description: React render-method --> renderes the Component.
classitems.name: render

classitems.description:
Clientside router.
See https://www.npmjs.com/package/itsa-react-router
classitems.name: router

classitems.description:
Clientside controller.
See https://www.npmjs.com/package/itsa-client-controller
classitems.name: controller

classitems.description:
IO object used for creating ajax-requests.
See http://itsa.io/docs/itsa-io/index.html
classitems.name: io

classitems.description:
Detaches all events that are set by the App. None of the "instance"-events need to be detached,
this happens full automaticly.
classitems.name: detachGlobalEvents

classitems.description: Injects a script into the page, as last childNode inside the "head"-Element.
classitems.name: insertScript

params.name: url
params.description: the url of the script that should be inserted.

return.description: A promise that gets resolved as soon as the script is loaded.

classitems.description:
Saves a hash inside the `router`. Can be invoked directly with a String,
or will be invoked on any "*:saveHistoryHash"-event.
classitems.name: saveHistoryHash

params.name: e
params.description: the url of the script that should be inserted.

classitems.description:
Sets up all events. None of the "instance"-events need to be detached,
this happens full automaticly.
classitems.name: setupEvents

classitems.description: Destroy-function for the App.
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: Port to run the Hapi-server.
classitems.name: port

classitems.description:
Maximum filesize within imagefiles to be transformed into DATA-URI images.
This prevents the client for making meny request to small image-files,
though this means that the css-file gets enlarged.

Do not set this value too high, for the size inside the css-file is bigger than
the filesize itself.

Used by webpack's url-loader plugin.
classitems.name: url-loader-limit

classitems.description: Whether the server should be in debug-mode.
classitems.name: debug

classitems.description:
Whether the css should be inline. Note that inline css prevents a blocking request on the client-side,
to this might be preferable.
On the other hand: large css-files should not be inlined --> this way they can be cached on the clientside.
classitems.name: inlinecss

classitems.description: The Google Analytics API-key. When set, then Google-analytics is automaticly activated for every pagevisit.
classitems.name: page-description

classitems.description: The sessiontime to store the client-state into the local storage
classitems.name: sessiontime

classitems.description:
The meta-viewport, to be set for three devices: desktop, phone and tablet.
These three devices are properties of the meta-viewport-object and should all hold a
String representing the meta-viewport of this device.
classitems.name: meta-viewport

classitems.description: The languages that are being used by this web-application.
classitems.name: languages

classitems.description: Any database settings, to be used inside the Models.
classitems.name: databases

classitems.description:
Any anvironment-specific configuration. Environment-specific configuration
will overrule the general settings as sson as this environment is running.
classitems.name: environments

classitems.description: Routes that will be used by the Hapi-server.
classitems.name: routes
